_header: Entirely beloved and most in my mind
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 382.
_description: An affirmation of devotion to his mistress, a love epistle — thirty-two lines in quatrains

BodRawC813.First Lines:
Entierly belouyd and most yn my myndeI me recommende yn most humble
                    wyse…
BodRawC813.Last Lines:
…To doo my deuour I haue neuer seassydebutt onely yow to loue
                    I take god to wyttnesse
BodRawC813.Editions:
Padelford,  Frederick Morgan. 
             “Liedersammlungen des xvi. Jahrhunderts…IV.” 
             Anglia
         31 (1908): 309-96: 368-9.
Jansen,  Sharon L.,  and  Kathleen H. Jordan, eds.

         Binghamton, NY: Medieval & Renaissance Texts and Studies,
            1991: 205-6.
